website_summaries.verdict: Designed for outdoor adventures and water activities, the new and improved Astral Rassler gets high marks for being extremely grippy. It has also struck hikers and sports enthusiasts with its lightweight construction and protective features. This boot definitely has the qualities you’re looking for from water footwear. Consider the Rassler 2.0 if you want a pair of quality boots that has the looks of a casual walking shoe.
pros: Lots of Astral Rassler 2.0 wearers consider it a very lightweight hiking boot
The soles are extremely grippy as well, according to most reviews
Several customers who have used it for hiking, kayaking, paddling, and biking are pleased with its performance
A significant number of users are extremely satisfied with the quick-drying properties of the Astral Rassler 2.0 water shoes
A handful of customers note that this shoe offers sufficient ankle protection
A few people say that this hiking footwear looks good for casual activities around the town
cons: A few reviewers note that the shoe runs a bit narrow

customer_reviews.title: Sole coming un-glued on 2.0 version
customer_reviews.text: Used these 3 days expedition kayaking. The shoe fit and grip were great! BUT after 3 days the seam at the toe started to come un-glued. The shoes still look new. This is just not acceptable for a shoe that cost this much. Very disappointing. Astral products have always been great for me in the past. All my other Astral products are excellent. First time with their shoes, not good.
customer_reviews.author: Frustrated Dad

customer_reviews.title: Fat shoes laces classic nerdy look perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight. Nice material & comfort ache support. Ordered a 8.5 women's/7.5 men's since these are unisex for outdoor trekking adventures. Perfect for mossy rocks in Creek crossings like Yosemite or Yellow Stone National Park. Highly recommend pairing with short thin waterproof socks just because im a sock wearing believer. Love the information printed on inside of box..I ordered the grey and really like the modern look of theses Astral Rasslers 2.0. My dislike is the shoe laces thickness I would have preferred a flat shoe laces instead of the round. However overall perfect for my nerdy needs.
customer_reviews.author: Almost Live Fan

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality, funny shape
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because a friend of mine wears them for sailing and I like the style. I have wide toes and usually wear Altra shoes for the wide toe box. These have a nice wide toe box, but the forefoot is actually quite narrow. They're very tight width wise on the ball of my foot. I'm giving them to my friend because he wears the same size. Grip was great, quality seems excellent. I like the nylon liner. They just don't fit my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Material inside is extremely rough and uncomfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t worn these in the water yet so I am unsure about overall performance. I will say they are extremely uncomfortable because the material inside is so stiff and so rough. I am nervous to wear these w/o socks in the water, as I can only imagine the blisters the stiff canvas feeling material will create.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Baer

customer_reviews.title: No slip for your river trip
customer_reviews.text: I bought these 3 sizes too big to fit over my stockingfoot waders and they have worked perfectly. They have held up nicely for over 50 days of fishing this Winter and Spring. River rocks are always slippery but these grippy souls will definitely save you some pain and anguish (any maybe some embarrassment too). I'll be buying another pair soon in my regular size to use for kayaking. My only complaint is that the laces are about to break, but it's partly to blame on the harsh metal clips that keep my Frog Togg waders from sliding up my legs.
customer_reviews.author: L. Mongillo

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced
customer_reviews.text: The soles are grippy but that's the extent of the upside. They allow grit to enter around the ankle and they don't dry out very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Henry E. Dorfman

customer_reviews.title: Light - Great Colorway
customer_reviews.text: Awesome colors, remind me of the Gorton's Fisherman. Something about the toe box is different though, Not necessarily bad but bulgie. Laces near the toe box don't really lay the toe box down, instead there's bulge at the toe. Overall a great shoe to throw on and mess around in... a tad hipster if you wear it casual but just don't be a hipster in general and you won't come off as one.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah Williams

customer_reviews.title: Best Water Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. This is my third pair. I haven't found another kayaking or water shoe that provides the comfort, support, and grip (even while wet or on wet surfaces) that these shoes offer. I also wear them mountain biking and casually.
customer_reviews.author: Raymundo

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, a little narrow compared to my other Astral shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe, a little narrow compared to my other Astral shoes
customer_reviews.author: Willisdick Fitinyomouth

customer_reviews.title: Fits a bit funky.
customer_reviews.text: Nice, well made water shoe with a grippy sole. But it’s short for its width. That may work for you, but if you don’t have stubby little toes I’d guess not. That’s always the problem, isn’t it? Small companies make products that fit their CEO and no one else :/ Since it’s a water shoe, there’s not a lot of cushioning. You’re going to be happiest if you wear a neoprene or thick wool sock (or both), and probably an insole if you intend to hike very far. That means adventure boaters and canyoneers will need to invest more energy in fitting than strict whitewater kayakers.
customer_reviews.author: F. Felix

customer_reviews.title: Smaller and more narrow than 1.0s
customer_reviews.text: I wear my Astral Rassler 1.0s nearly every day. The soles on the 1.0s are starting to separate from the uppers and I needed new Rasslers. I understand the 2.0s address the sole separation of the 1.0s. Excited, I bought the same size but the 2.0s feel too narrow. I will go up a half size, hopefully they will fit better. I love my 1.0 and want to love some 2.0
customer_reviews.author: Angela J Whicker

product_meta.title: Astral Rassler 2.0 Outdoor Minimalist Shoes, Grippy and Lightweight, Made for Whitewater, Canyoneering, Fly Fishing, and Travel
product_meta.description:
The Rassler 2.0 is an exceptionally grippy and rugged, yet lightweight boot that dries fast and drains quick. The sole is redesigned for improved durability. Mid-Cut upper provides extra protection and support. Our best choice for hardcore river users.

Fit: True to size (up to D width)
Weight/shoe: Men's 9 = 222g (7.8 oz)
Foot to ground distance: 17mm heel, 16mm ball
feature_bullets: GRANITE GRIP 2.0: Made for surfaces smooth, wet and rocky; Allows excellent flex and sensory feedback for enhanced grip and balance; With razor-siping, divided lugs and a maximized surface area

EXTRA TRACTION: High performance G.ss rubber outsole is extra grippy with high surface contact for extra traction; Low durometer rubber conforms to the ground and provides excellent abrasion resistance
MADE FOR WATER: Built-in Polygiene treated sockliner to eliminate odor, holes in the front and back to drain water, and mesh to vent hot air; Hydrophobic, quick-dry canvas and water resistant laces
BALANCED FEEL: Level footbed promotes balance and agility; Wider toe box lets your toes spread out for stability; Lightweight enough to believe you're actually barefoot (222g/shoe)
SUPPORT AND PROTECTION: Padded ankle and heel counter for extra support; TPU overlays for protection in rugged terrain
